channel.title: Do You Know Java on T[h]inking
channel.description: Recent content in Do You Know Java on T[h]inking

item.title: Do you know Java: Entry Point in Interface or Enum
item.description: All Java applications start with a class and an entry point in it. We can change the class type to others. All Java applications start at one mutual point. That is a class which has at least one static method, called main as an entry point of the app. This method is called by JRE after the class is loaded when we execute java command with the appropriate name of the class.

item.title: Do you know Java: Double Brace Initialization
item.description: Double brace initialization is a very comfortable way to add values to a collection or pairs to a map instance instead of having multiple statements next to each other. One of the most popular languages, though Java is full of interesting parts that look wierd or unusual at first glance. In the sequence I call Do you know Java, I would like to present these less known or unexplained parts of the languages.
